entry.title: GPars meets Virtual Threads
entry.summary: This post looks at using GPars with virtual threads.

entry.title: Using Groovy with Apache Wayang and Apache Spark
entry.summary: This post looks at using Apache Wayang and Apache Spark with Apache Groovy to cluster various Whiskies.

entry.title: Classifying Iris Flowers with Deep Learning, Groovy and GraalVM
entry.summary: This post looks at classifying Iris flowers using traditional and neural net based approaches using Eclipse DeepLearning4j, Encog, Deep Netts and GraalVM.

entry.title: Parsing JSON with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at parsing JSON using Groovy's in-built capabilities as well as some other libraries.

entry.title: Testing your Java with Groovy, Spock, JUnit5, Jacoco, Jqwik and Pitest
entry.summary: This post looks at testing Java using Groovy, Spock, JUnit5, Jacoco, Jqwik and Pitest

entry.title: Comparators and Sorting in Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at Groovy functionality for making your classes comparable and/or sortable.

entry.title: Groovy release train: 4.0.4, 3.0.12, 2.5.18
entry.summary: Groovy 4.0.4, 3.0.12 and 2.5.18 Release Announcement.

entry.title: Reading and Writing CSV files with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at processing CSV files using OpenCSV, Commons CSV, and Jackson Databind libraries.

entry.title: Working with SQL databases with Groovy and GraalVM
entry.summary: This post looks at a simple H2 database application. It shows how to create a native version of the application using GraalVM.

entry.title: Detecting objects with Groovy, the Deep Java Library (DJL), and Apache MXNet
entry.summary: This post looks at using Apache Groovy, DLJ and Apache MXNet to use neural networks to detect objects within an image.

entry.title: Natural Language Processing with Groovy, OpenNLP, CoreNLP, Nlp4j, Datumbox, Smile, Spark NLP, DJL and TensorFlow
entry.summary: This post looks at numerous common natural language processing tasks using Groovy and a range of NLP libraries.

entry.title: Life on Mars: Units of Measurement systems, Groovy, and domain specific languages (DSLs)
entry.summary: This post looks at using the JSR 385 unit of measurement system and writing domain specific languages with examples including the Mars rover robot.

entry.title: Matrix calculations with Groovy, Apache Commons Math, ojAlgo, Nd4j and EJML
entry.summary: This post looks at using Groovy to write a number of applications involving matrices. It uses a number of open source matrix libraries.

entry.title: Groovy List Processing Cheat Sheet
entry.summary: This post looks at the common Groovy features for processing lists.

entry.title: Solving cryptarithmetic puzzles with Groovy and constraint programming using Choco, JaCoP, and OR-Tools
entry.summary: This post looks at solving cryptarithmetic puzzles using Groovy.

entry.title: Calculating Fibonacci with Groovy revisited
entry.summary: This post looks at various ways to calculate Fibonacci numbers such as recursion and iteration including optimisations like tail recursion and memoization.

entry.title: Encryption and decryption with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at encrypting and decrypting data using Groovy with the AES and CAST5 algorithms.

entry.title: Deck of cards with Groovy, JDK collections and Eclipse Collections
entry.summary: This post highlights some code for modelling and manipulating cards with records, JDK collections, and Eclipse Collections.

entry.title: Deep Learning and Eclipse Collections
entry.summary: This post uses Emojis and Eclipse Collections to process pet records. We then use deep learning to predict whether each emoji looks like a dog or cat.

entry.title: Fruity Eclipse Collections
entry.summary: This post looks at using KMeans to compare fruit nominated color with the colors used in its emoji.

entry.title: Groovy Dates And Times Cheat Sheet
entry.summary: This post looks at data and time functionality in Groovy including classic and Java date time, JSR310, functionality.

entry.title: Whiskey Clustering with Groovy and Apache Ignite
entry.summary: This post looks at using Apache Ignite with Apache Groovy and the K-Means algorithm to cluster scotch whiskeys.

entry.title: Zipping Collections with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at zipping collections.

entry.title: Fun with obfuscated Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at some Obfuscated code for outputting some well-known text.

entry.title: Adventures with GroovyFX
entry.summary: This blog looks at a GroovyFX TODO application.

entry.title: JVM Hello World with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at using bytecode libraries to generate class files. It's a deep dive into how compilers and other tools work behind the scenes.

entry.title: Apache Groovy 2022 Year In Review
entry.summary: This post looks back at some highlights for Groovy in 2022.

entry.title: Fun with rating stars
entry.summary: Inspired by a recent tweet, this blog looks at producing a string of stars corresponding to a rating.

entry.title: Groundhog Day
entry.summary: Inspired by a recent tweet, this blog looks at some datetime manipulations to calculate the period between Groundhog day and the start of Spring.

entry.title: Groovy Processing Nulls In Lists
entry.summary: This post looks at processing lists containing nulls in Groovy.

entry.title: Checking Wordle with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at writing a Wordle checker in Groovy.

entry.title: Australian Time Zones
entry.summary: Inspired by a recent update related to Antarctic timezones, this post looks at some interesting Australian time zone facts.

entry.title: Quake III Arena and the fast inverse square root algorithm
entry.summary: Inspired by a recent tweet, this blog looks at the fast inverse square root algorithm made famous in Quake III Arena.

entry.title: Converting natural language into actions with NLPCraft and Groovy
entry.summary: This blog looks at using Apache NLPCraft from Groovy.

entry.title: Groovy Testing with Combinations and Permutations
entry.summary: This blog looks at testing with Groovy using Combinations and Permutations.

entry.title: Groovy Haiku processing
entry.summary: This blog looks at processing some creative writing looking at various properties of the letters within the text.

entry.title: Groovy Records
entry.summary: This blog looks at Groovy records.

entry.title: Hello World with Emojis
entry.summary: This post looks at a Groovy hello world with some emoji fun.

entry.title: Lego Bricks with Groovy
entry.summary: This post compares Groovy built-in capabilities to Java and Eclipse Collections.

entry.title: Groovy and Sequenced Collections (JEP-431)
entry.summary: This post looks at Groovy support for sequenced collections.

entry.title: Groovy Record Performance
entry.summary: This post looks at the performance of some of the generated methods in Groovy records.

entry.title: Creating a Groovy Blog Post
entry.summary: This post looks at the steps to create a blog post.

entry.title: Processing Results for the Critérium du Dauphiné
entry.summary: This post looks at processing the general classification results for the Critérium du Dauphiné using Groovy, GQuery and DuckDB.

entry.title: Using Apache Pekko actors and GPars actors with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at using Apache Pekko Actors and GPars Actors with Groovy.

entry.title: ChatGPT meets Groovy one-liners
entry.summary: I asked ChatGPT if it could represent some short/one-liner programming-related dad jokes as short/one-liner Groovy scripts.

entry.title: Community Over Code (North America) 2023
entry.summary: This post looks at the ASF Community Over Code conference in Halifax, Nova Scotia, October 7-10 2023, with a particular focus on the Groovy Track.

entry.title: Set Operators with Groovy
entry.summary: This blog looks at union, intersection, difference & symmetric difference operators in Groovy.

entry.title: Using Gatherers with Groovy
entry.summary: This post looks at using Gatherers (JEP 461) with Groovy.

entry.title: Season’s Greetings with Emojis
entry.summary: Season's greetings with some emoji fun.

entry.title: Groovy Type Checkers
entry.summary: This post looks at Groovy's Type Checkers.
